title: Giornata Internazionale di Studi - Can the Damage of Destructive Polarization Be Repaired?
snippet: Giada Marino, Bruna Almeida Paroni, and Fabio Giglietto from the University of Urbino Carlo Bo presented on "The Brazilian Digital Battlefield: Investigating The Dynamics Of Political Information Campaigns In Post-Bolsonaro Era". This study investigates the dynamics of misinformation campaigns on Facebook in the context of Brazil's political landscape.
description: Fabio Giglietto from the University of Urbino Carlo Bo presented research on misinformation campaigns in Brazil at a conference on destructive polarization.

title: SICSS-Bologna - Summer Institute in Computational Social Science
snippet: Fabio Giglietto is mentioned as an Associate Professor in the Department of Communication Sciences, Humanities, and International Studies at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo. His research focuses on the interplay between digital media and societal transformations, particularly on how digital platforms influence public opinion and democratic processes.
description: This webpage from the SICSS-Bologna 2024 describes Fabio Giglietto as an Associate Professor at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo, highlighting his research on the interplay between digital media and societal transformations and digital platform influence on public opinion and democratic processes.

title: How to Detect a Disinformation Campaign - Media Ecosystems Analysis Group
snippet: Fabio Giglietto is interviewed about how actors respond to social media platforms' attempts to crack down on coordinated behavior. He discusses his research on COVID-19 mis- and disinformation in Italy and the importance of coordination between social media actors in spotting mis- and disinformation.
description: Fabio Giglietto is interviewed on a podcast about detecting disinformation campaigns. He discusses his research on COVID-19 misinformation in Italy and the coordination between social media actors in spotting disinformation.

Il Premio Rimini Mundi a sette ambasciatori del congressuale - lapiazzarimini.it
Advancing Research on Disinformation and Digital Manipulation: The University of Urbino at two Key Conferences in Brazil – vera.ai VERification Assisted by Artificial Intelligence
snippet: Professor Fabio Giglietto presented collaborative research with Dr. Giada Marino and Bruna Paroni at the International Seminar on Disinformation, Social Media, and Climate in Porto Alegre. Their research explores an innovative approach to analyzing political discourse using fine-tuned large language models (LLMs) to examine political talk in hyperpartisan Facebook groups.
description: This article discusses Professor Fabio Giglietto's presentation of collaborative research on analyzing political discourse in hyperpartisan Facebook groups using LLMs at an international seminar in Brazil. It directly relates to his expertise in social media, disinformation, and communication research, indicating a third-party mention of his work.

title: Il movimento religioso cinese che si è infiltrato in un gruppo Facebook urbinate - il Ducato
Who is behind vera.ai? Meet the people and teams that make up the vera.ai project. #8 Team of University of Urbino Carlo Bo
snippet: This article introduces the University of Urbino Carlo Bo team involved in the vera.ai project. Fabio Giglietto leads the team, which coordinates Work Package 4 (WP4) within the vera.ai project, focusing on detecting potentially problematic content in near-real-time by addressing coordinated sharing behavior.
description: This article from vera.ai introduces the University of Urbino Carlo Bo team, led by Fabio Giglietto, which coordinates Work Package 4 (WP4) focused on detecting potentially problematic content by addressing coordinated sharing behavior.
